oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The December Number of "The Fugitive" is now on the stands

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "The Fugitive: A Magazine of Poetry from the South," Published in Nashville, Tenn., was published from April 1922 to December 1925. Contributors to this issue: Witter Bynner, Donald Davidson, William Frierson, Robert Graves, Sidney M. Hirsch, Stanley Johnson, Merrill Moore, David Morton, William Alexander Percy, John Crowe Ransom, Alec R. Stevenson, Allen Tate, Ridley Wills. Single Copies 25c -- A Year $1.00."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Poetry; Poets; Literature
Broadsides; American poetry - Periodicals; Fugitives (Group)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fugitives (Group)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Fugitives were a group of influential poets and writers based at Vanderbilt University in the 1920s. Ushering in the "New Criticism," their eponymous publication became one of the most important literary organs of the 20th century.
